title: CL Men vs. CL Women
text:
Lets get this clear at the start, you are right that there are very few decent men on CL. I am, unfortunately, not one of those select few. Rather, I am in the other 99% that are there purely to satisfy rather base physical urges, with no thought of wanting anything more.

That having been said, I do think that there are a far greater number of decent women on CL, as it seems to me most women are searching for a LTR. This difference speaks not to which sex is more noble, but instead simply to the fact that both sexes work from far different impulses.

I do agree that both sexes are equally desperate, that is for what they are seeking. Men for sex, and women for something special and long term, as they see hear biological clocks ticking. I am not sure which is more pathetic.

Oh, you might think that its sweet that women are searching for something so pristine. But, I think what women are seeking is something fictional. Indeed, how many happy couples are there out there? Very few.

It is a particular pet peeve of mine that when I talk to a woman from CL that she seems to have little to say. Indeed, I can post a lengthy ad on CL and get a one line response that is usually a fragment and not even a complete sentence. It tells me nothing about the woman, other than perhaps she is lacking in

some basic literacy skills. When I reply simply with "Tell me about yourself", she disappears. It is an easy question. All you have to do is tell me where you are from, what you do, your age, etc. I don't need your bra size, how you keep yourself groomed or your social security number.

title: Important Advice for Women!
text:
Here's some free, important advice for you ladies to ponder this weekend if you have the time and inclination. Some of it may be difficult to read but if you're honest with yourself, most of you will have to admit that you're guilty of doing one or more of these things. So read it, trying to be as objective and honest as you can. You'll thank me later....;) 

And for those of you who HAVEN'T been guilty of this behavior, I salute you. 

* DON'T SETTLE
So many people settle for a partner who they're not in love with. Men do it too but women do it more frequently. I'm not sure if this is due to the biological clock factor, to insecurity or to both. But as someone who has seen more than his share of divorces, I can tell you pretty confidently that it's not worth it. Instead of settling for someone who is just okay, it's better to wait a little longer and meet someone who is more than that. And if you don't meet that someone, honestly, it's better to remain single (despite what society tells you). More often than not, women are single in their 20s... married or seriously involved in their 30s... and divorced (often with children) in their 40s. It's an epidemic. 

* DON'T THINK WITH YOUR VAGINA
Another epidemic. Sorry to be blunt but women are no different from men when it comes to thinking with their crotches these days. If you're going do that, at least BE HONEST about what you're doing -- not just with the other person but with yourself. Don't confuse lust with love. Lust doesn't last. 

* DON'T MAKE A MAN YOUR WHOLE WORLD
I've seen this happen more than once -- in fact, I'm seeing it now with a friend of mine -- and it's really disturbing. Again, women are more susceptible to this than men are for some reason. Many of you, once you start seeing a new guy, make that guy your whole life and fall out of touch with your friends, family members, etc. In addition to hurting your friends and family, you wind up hurting YOURSELF with this behavior. Being that most relationships don't last (especially those that start off like fireworks), it's just a matter of time before you find yourself alone. And when that happens -- and you start calling your old friends, acting like you haven't been ignoring them for ages and expecting to just pick up where you left off -- don't be surprised if they don't want you back in their lives. 

* DON'T ASSUME THERE ARE ONLY TWO TYPES OF MEN
For some strange reason, many women assume there are only two types of men out there: straight guys who are macho assholes and gay men. They tend to date the former and befriend the latter. Dating the former is a problem though (which sometimes relates to my next point) because most macho assholes don't know how to treat a woman; they're all dick and no heart, basically. In fact, we men represent a much broader spectrum and the best of us, in my opinion, are often straight men who are also sensitive and who know how to communicate and how to treat a woman with class.

* DON'T REPEAT THE SAME NEGATIVE RELATIONSHIP PATTERNS, AD NAUSEUM
There is a sad vicious cycle that many women (though obviously not all) get trapped in. Basically, it goes something like this: you get hurt -- emotionally, physically or both -- by your father or by your first boyfriend. Then one of two things happens. Most of the time, though you may not be doing it consciously, you continue to choose men who treat you badly and repeat what happened with your father or first boyfriend (in psychological terms, it's called a "repetition compulsion"). Chances are, you eventually find out that the guy is either unfaithful, abusive or both. In addition, he doesn't know how to communicate. You can't understand why things continue to go wrong for you in relationships and this only confirms your suspicion that all men are horrible. It's sort of a self-fulfilling prophecy. 

But sometimes option #2 happens. You meet a nice guy -- but you either you don't trust that he's really nice or you don't feel worthy of being treated well. After all, it's never happened before, right? So you start trying to alienate him (again, this is often subconscious). Eventually, you succeed. Now, not only have you once again confirmed your suspicion that all men are horrible but you've let a good opportunity slip away and maybe even turned a nice guy into a jerk in the process. And -- to get back to my first piece of advice -- you often wind up going back to the guy who didn't treat you well. So a final word of advice, ladies. Try to start working out your shit BEFORE you start looking for a relationship. It will benefit both you and the men you meet.

text:
"Discovering your shared interests"
or
"Discovering their body"

If you answered "Discovering your shared interests" (the most common female answer by far for the +40 years old set), then what are you doing here on CL? Match or OKC will be way more productive for you.

However, if you answered "Discovering their body", then we have a more interesting situation. 

So let's delve a little deeper. When you look in the mirror, do you see a hot, sexy woman? Have you taken care of yourself over the years, and can you pass for someone younger? Are you more exciting and adventurous than people would guess? Want to explore having lots of steamy, creative fun of a kind that perhaps you passed on when you were younger, when you were more shy and inexperienced, or had more family responsibilities?

Yes, it's hard to find a suitable companion for the above. You need someone you trust and enjoy speaking with, who is smart and presentable in normal social situations, and who is in very good physical condition. AND they need to have that same, usually repressed, little kinky edge that you do.

title: I hate people

All I do anymore is wait for my days off and when they come... I pretty much accomplish nothing. If my new roommates want a door, they can figure that shit out for themselves or gtfo. I'm already way more than accommodating and already miss being able to run through the rooms in my underwear twirling and shit and talking to myself. I also went to Staples to try and scan both sides of my birth certificate and their stupid thing wasn't working right and kept spitting out gray lines. Rather than talk to a human, I just went home. I had an awesome dream, though. I was sitting on the couch in the house I grew up in with my dad on the opposite end of the couch, my mom in the kitchen and sister eating cereal at the kitchen table... Everything was peaceful, but in my mind I "knew" that it was a post-apocalyptic world, which explained the extra people. There was an unnecessarily gorgeous teen girl (the kind that wears too much make-up at too young of an age) that was going to bed and quickly gave me a peck on the lips and said "good night." She wants 200+ bucks in pills for a BJ or some shit. It's turning me off. In my mind, I'm fucking Walter White. I'm the danger and I have the power! You don't make the rules! I stop myself and I'm like, "Well, I could let that bother me or I can go with it and have an experience." She continues the charade and finds 40 dollars and then just stands there apologizing and again wonders aloud if she has anything to pay me with, then stares into my eyes and looks away. She wants to suggest it, but she's being coy. "Take off your clothes," I say simply. I literally watch her gulp. She stands there for like 20 seconds. I can't get it the fuck in if she keeps pulling away and it's turning me off again and making me lose my boner. She totally wanted what just happened and was a cunt about the entire thing. title: Looking to date a genuine adult...seems hard to find in this town
text:
A lot of people come to New York City to find themselves. I respect that. The trouble is, I'm not one of them. I come from NYC, I have roots here. I'm not here on a voyage of self-discovery.

In fact, I pretty much know who I am at this point. I have a fulfilling career, which involves helping poor people to get jobs. Oddly enough, I get paid decently for this. I have close family ties, powerful passions and interests, and a pretty good group of friends. I'm evolving all the time, sure, but I'm not reinventing myself from scratch.

Yet oddly enough, the more defined and confident I become, the more trouble I have dating. And for some reason, most of the people who respond to my online personal ads are just passing through NYC, or they just arrived on the aforementioned journey of self-discovery, or they're still students and therefore young enough to be my kids. At this point, I'm practically dying to meet another person who is even remotely settled and, for lack of a better word, "adult." 

Not that I'm knocking being young at heart. I have a childish enthusiasm about some things. I just take life a bit more seriously than most millennials.

For example: many years ago, I gave up sleeping around. I toned down my drinking. And I was never into drugs or exhibitionism on social media. I suppose that all makes me old-fashioned, but that can be a strength. If you date me, you can count on me to be loyal. To not jump into bed with the next person who flirts with me. You can count on me to actually build a life with you.

I'm looking for someone who is in a similar place. Sadly, most young New Yorkers (men and women alike) seem to be fucking their way through an eternal adolescence. Even if they're successful and adult in many ways, their emotional intelligence seems rather stunted, and they're often super-cynical. I'm sick of those people. I want a woman, not a brat. As I'm sure you want a man, not a fratboy.

Well, maybe I'm your man. So, if you haven't fallen asleep by this point in the ad, drop me a line.

title: My Poetic Letter to Santa. (I'm Early for Next Year)...
text:
Dear Santa,

I'm writing to you with my only wish this year,
I'm hoping that you'll bring her here.

I've been good this year, I've been a good boy.
Won't you bring me a nice girl to share in the Christmas joy?

We'll make eggnog, sing carols and dance to Christmas music don't you know.
We'll hug and kiss right under the mistletoe.

Santa, can you bring her this year and tell her to stay under the the tree,
Won't you bring me that special cutie...Santa, just for me?

I promise to use my handy skills and fix your sleigh,
I'll get her tuned up like new and get you back on your way.

I want what you and Mrs. Claus have, because it's great,
After all, for nine months out of the year, you're parked in the Sunshine State!

Santa, please bring me an angel to make my year complete,
If you can do this for me, it's quite a feat!

I promise to hug and keep her warm and safe from all that is bad,
Because a great girl in the arms of a nice guy is the best thing that can be had.

We'll celebrate Christmas like only an Italian Catholic can do,
If you grant my wish, they'll be lots of Italian cookies for you.

Santa, bring her with Prancer, Dancer, and with all the fixin's,
Just make sure if she's cute and sassy, she's not some evil Vixen.

I know you'll bring me someone cute, sweet and bright.
Someone who will always bring their radiant smile into the night.

Santa we will grow together and celebrate the Holidays together like only a great duo can do.
C'mon Jolly Ole Buddy, I'm counting on you.


Santa, I hope she's Caucasian, cute, sweet, and without any elves,
This way we can have fun together and be ourselves.

I hope that she doesn't smoke, because that wouldn't be nice,
Because if she's a sweetheart, under the mistletoe, she'll be kissed twice.

I will hold her hand and make her feel safe and smiling ear to ear,
It's the spirit and form of this letter that I want her to hear.

Because Christmas is magic and Christmas is fun,
And for all the fun we'll have together, it's only just begun.

So Santa, I'll ask you one more time, can you grant my wish? 
Remember Jolly Ole' Buddy, they'll be an something extra in the cookie dish.

Let me end it here, old fellow, because I'm going to have sweet dreams of good things,
Hoping that that special sweet girl to call my own is who you'll bring.

title: The Twenty Five Things that Intrigue Me About a Lady. Have Any?

2) Her long hair flowing in the breeze.
3) The warmth of her eyes 
4) Her infectious smile
4) A phone call from her, just because.
5) A warm hug and kiss.
6) A good deed to someone who needs it.
7) An act of faith showing her good values and upbringing.
8) A nice outfit to show she values who she is inside and out.
9) Her warmth around friends and family.
10) The way she carries herself at work, but is always herself.

24) Listening to her talk about nostalgia
25) Getting to enjoy #1 through #24 with her because she had the gumption to answer this ad.

Who am I? Master's Degree, Island native, don't smoke, no children, Catholic, Italian, good-natured, handy, witty, normal and grounded, average build, 5'9".

title: Horny+Intelligent=Lonely +/- Happy
text:
Approaching strangers in bars has proven to be wildly unpredictable, and a formalized online dating subscription is altogether too crass; so we find ourselves left with the uncomfortable middle-ground, bourgeois solution of Craigslist over loneliness; forced to seek each other out amidst a dank netherworld of slightly funky secondhand futons. 
I am a single M, 35, semi-tall (5'8), winsome, mildly misanthropic but friendly upon close inspection, and I seek a wealthy fun-loving black/latin/mixed/asian/ supermodel with impossibly low standards with all of her limbs; Just kidding, I don't discriminate on race, religion or height.

In this posting, I am not going to talk about how I love to laugh, or how I'm equally comfortable in a tuxedo at a black tie gala as at a dive bar, or how I look (or act) much younger than my age, or that I am looking for that special someone who I can take to the beach at sunset for long walks and philosophical talks. Not that any of those things are not necessarily me, but I'll try to be direct in who I am without any sugar-coating. In relationships, all we really have is the truth. As Billy Joel sang in the late 70s when he was still cool and relevant, "Honesty, it's such a lonely word." My personality can probably be summed up like this: I'm neurotic about very specific things (and don't hide it, which imparts some of my sense of humor), but at the same time, I'm extremely laid back about most other things. This is the paradox that I inhibit uninhibitedly (Cute, huh? That just happened!). 

I find stuffy rooms with no air circulation almost unbearable, and immediately start looking for a window to open; I do love the smell that incense gives from time to time and a big fan of pachouli; I have a strong preference for sitting on the left side of a date in a movie or on a couch (otherwise it feels like trying to write with the wrong hand); On the contrary, I wouldn't have much of an opinion on where a picture was to be hung or where to put a plant (then again, that just might be a "straight guy" thing). To be clear, I don't have OCD, I just exhibit occasional symptoms. :) Judging from my friends, I seem to be neurotic in an amusing way. I enjoy people that are comfortable being direct. I'm just not built for a lot of small talk. What you're REALLY thinking is always more interesting to me. (Inner dialogue, when can be totally fucking hilarious). It'd be great if you were: easy-going, supportive, optimistic (positive in general), affectionate like me (This is really important)..... in my opinion, head massages are extremely underrated.... someone who also loves the beach. You make me think, call me on my bullshit, and wouldn't get offended when I reciprocate. You have the ability to freely laugh at yourself. I love the quirks in people. The things that make you different from everyone else are the most interesting things to me. And you love to make out. Ultimately I'm looking for a long term relationship; one with a special connection. I like spontaneity, but really appreciate having set plans. I like making plans to be spontaneous. I'm an optimist that's sometime mistaken as a pessimist. I'm easy-going, sometimes too blunt, but that's tempered with a consistent stream of self-deprecation. What else about me? I work in biotech, and commute (sometimes via train or bus or cab) down to midtown or the upper east side on weekdays. I'm 5'8", 170 lbs. I'm fairly active: tennis, basketball, mountain biking. I like going to see films, sharing a big bag of popcorn and one of those new flavored cokes. I usually prefer movies that try to be something different. Other stuff I like: traveling (just went to Brazil to help save the rain forest and amazon river. It was incredible. I was in Tibet and Thailand recently as well. Board games and game nights, farmers' markets, Amoeba Records (even though I don't even buy CDs anymore - sad), exploring new places, The Following, The Walking Dead, Fresh Prince of Belair old episodes,(I think Terri Gross has a sexy voice); playing Scrabble at the beach. I aspire to learn to throw a frisbee well, but don't have very high expectations at this point. I quietly exist as a humongous fan of the Yankees and Knicks and happy BK has a team!!! NO, I am not perfect AND...... if you haven't already been able to tell, I love using parentheses. 

Silly me. What am i looking for? A friend. I didn't say benefits though although that never hurts. As you can also tell, if you were into the later, I am drama free so it never hurts to be upfront, bold and honest. Tell me what you are looking for and if we click you at least can say you met someone new and exciting. 

Please don't write to me and ask, "so tell me more about yourself!" Damn, I think I did a pretty thorough job (probably a bit too thorough for some of you). Please tell me a bit about yourself and PLEASE INCLUDE WHERE YOU LIVE, AND A PIC never hurt. (sorry bout the caps lock.) Thanks

I'm just not built for a lot of small talk. What you're REALLY thinking is always more interesting to me. (Inner dialogue, when can be totally fucking hilarious). It'd be great if you were: easy-going, supportive, optimistic (positive in general), affectionate like me (This is really important)..... in my opinion, head massages are extremely underrated.... someone who also loves the beach. You make me think, call me on my bullshit, and wouldn't get offended when I reciprocate. You have the ability to freely laugh at yourself. I love the quirks in people. The things that make you different from everyone else are the most interesting things to me. And you love to make out. Ultimately I'm looking for a long term relationship; one with a special connection. I like spontaneity, but really appreciate having set plans. I like making plans to be spontaneous. I'm an optimist that's sometime mistaken as a pessimist. I'm easy-going, sometimes too blunt, but that's tempered with a consistent stream of self-deprecation. What else about me? I work in biotech, and commute (sometimes via train or bus or cab) down to midtown or the upper east side on weekdays. I'm 5'8", 170 lbs. I'm fairly active: tennis, basketball, mountain biking. I like going to see films, sharing a big bag of popcorn and one of those new flavored cokes. I usually prefer movies that try to be something different. Other stuff I like: traveling (just went to Brazil to help save the rain forest and amazon river. It was incredible. I was in Tibet and Thailand recently as well. Board games and game nights, farmers' markets, Amoeba Records (even though I don't even buy CDs anymore - sad), exploring new places, The Following, The Walking Dead, Fresh Prince of Belair old episodes,(I think Terri Gross has a sexy voice); playing Scrabble at the beach. I aspire to learn to throw a frisbee well, but don't have very high expectations at this point. I quietly exist as a humongous fan of the Yankees and Knicks and happy BK has a team!!! NO, I am not perfect AND...... if you haven't already been able to tell, I love using parentheses. 

Silly me. What am i looking for? A friend. I didn't say benefits though although that never hurts. As you can also tell, if you were into the later, I am drama free so it never hurts to be upfront, bold and honest. Tell me what you are looking for and if we click you at least can say you met someone new and exciting. 

Please don't write to me and ask, "so tell me more about yourself!" Damn, I think I did a pretty thorough job (probably a bit too thorough for some of you). Please tell me a bit about yourself and PLEASE INCLUDE WHERE YOU LIVE, AND A PIC never hurt. (sorry bout the caps lock.) Thanks

title: need advice I'm in love with my mistress, but can't divorce my wife.
text:
I'm in love with my mistress, but can't divorce my wife.
I have been married for 21 years and have two wonderful kids with my wife. over the past years, my marriage has grown from full of intimacy (but with lots of fights as well) to zero intimacy (and fewer fights).
I met this woman some years ago and we started meeting Up secretly She is divorced with two kids. I started off completely for the wrong reasons, you know, the usual 

reasons why men look for thrill from another woman. We had lots of intimacy and she gave me no worry at all and seemed to know how to play the affair game correctly. All was really fantastic. i have hardly been intimate with my wife even before the affair. so this woman came after and seemed to fill my void. a few months of being with her, i felt that she is truly a very nice person, smart, caring and very capable I started to see her beauty other than her physical good looks and she has atmany occasions sacrificed her time, life priority and energy to give me happiness, satisfy my physical needs, helped me financially....all with nothing in return. I slowly fell in love with her and started comparing her with my wife. There were days and nights when we sleep together, talk about life dreams and goals, sharing the same passion lifestyle etc she appeared to be the woman of my dreams!

I lied to my mistress when she asked if I am still intimate with my wife, but it was only to prevent hurt, but she asks me constantly because she knows the truth, she knows better, its almost as if she has radar that senses we have been intimate , or is it the connection between us . I feel I had better tell her the truth, she is starting to doubt me, lose faith in my words, and I feel this lie is now causeing a stari9n on this relationship. 
I think my mistress is going to leave me, or perhaps find a reason to lie to me in return because she knows I am liing , she sees right through it. What do I do now?


I didn't really consciously think about all these that I've written here until she started to feel hurt in this relationship. She is hurt because she was falling deeper in love for me as well and started to feel bad every time i have to go home. We started arguing, and I've even told her that she knew i wad married before starting out with me, she signed for the package etc...months passed and i can not even yet such words anymore to convince her to stay because I've also fallen deeper for her. Seeing her in pain, i unwillingly told her to do what's best for her which mainly means her seeing and meeting new men. But when she did find a new male friend who seemed to be very personal with her, i went berserk. I had a big fight with her and she was stuck again with me. I think I've fallen in love with her and there's no way i could let her go with another men. The feeling was horrible.

I am , very in love with this woman, and I am starting to see that I am only happy when I am with her. I need to find a way to make this woman stay in my life . 

We've been together for almost 9 years. She's suffered enough seeing me leaving her for home every time i had to leave.
I hate myself door not having the courage to divorce and my affair is still suffering. She's proposed to end the whole thing so that we both can move on. I tried to, but i just can't stop thinking of her, the dreams we talked about, her love and care for me. I have also grown wanting her intimate, hug, kiss, smell her and am so comfortable with even her body smell, her hair, her skin. I think I've truly fallen in love. She's the one 
I used to have the standard road map in my head, graduate, get a good job, marry settle down, kids, house etc....every thing about my life seemed well chartered. Friends admire me . This affair, my life perspective completely changed. She is the exact opposite of what I married. She and I are so much more compatible then my wife and I would've be. sharing moments with her, doing things with her, etc and i have started to see the world with more than just black and white shades. I'm so deeply in love.

However, I feel if I don't make a move and give her something to look forward to, I'm going to lose this woman, she's determined to cut off from me although she's failed several times because of her love for me. I've failed too but i can't find the courage to divorce, I love my kids and am hoping for an amicable divorce and plan ahead for our adolecent kids but i don't think any divorce will end up amicable. . 
I'm stuck. i love this woman very mmuch What do I do , to keep this woman in my life. 
Can anyone help me? I'm crying in pain.....

According to other articles, most people fall squarely into one of the personality types, but some inhabit all the qualities of not one, but multiple types. One way or another, I've gotten an answer from almost everyone I know, as to which type they think I fall into. Some thought Artist, some Mechanic, some Thinker, but most couldn't decide between the three. Looking back on my life, I can find countless situations where I exhibited the qualities of all three types, in spades... besides the obvious facts that I'm an artist, work with technology, and avid thinker. 

The Artist..... quiet, serious, sensitive, kind, loyal, faithful, flexible, open-minded, original & creative. Don't like conflict. Extremely well-developed senses, and aesthetic appreciation for beauty. Not interested in leading or controlling others. Enjoy the present moment. 

The Mechanic..... quiet, reserved, interested in how and why things work. Excellent skills with mechanical things. Risk-takers who live for the moment. Usually interested in and talented at extreme sports. Uncomplicated in their desires. Loyal to their peers and to their internal value systems, but not overly concerned with respecting laws and rules if they get in the way of getting something done. Detached and analytical, they excel at finding solutions to practical problems.

The Thinker..... a logical, original, creative thinker. Can become very excited about theories and ideas. Capable and driven to turn theories into clear understandings. Highly value knowledge, competence and logic. Quiet and reserved, hard to get to know well. Individualistic, having no interest in leading or following others.

The reason I'm rambling on about my personality type is that, most of my friends seem to think I'm infatuated with someone that doesn't exist in the real world. Given all the work I do with fantasy stories and, animated films/series and characters, I can see why they might get that idea. But the qualities I find so attractive, aren't really that hard to find. Like an alabaster/milky complexion, long blonde hair, blue eyes, breasts so big they impart their own gravity, pink nipples & lips (all 4 of them), a huge squeezable ass. A brittle gentle soft-spoken voice, fragile, vulnerable, shy, cutesy, dramatic. More likely to wear short-shorts/skirts/dresses... than pants, basically as feminine as they come. 

Sure my attraction to those qualities might be a little vain but those are just the qualities I find most attractive. Whether you're intellectual or air-headed, athletic and/or delicate, the housewife type or have your own career aspirations, very quiet or a chatterbox, great in a conversation or a shy mumbler, sexually open-minded or very inhibited, thin or a BBW, short or tall...... I could be attracted to someone with any combination of those qualities. And, believe it or not, I've met quite a few women who had any number of those qualities, even ones who had them all. Usually what stood in the way.... a huge age difference, a lack of mutual attraction, or a little youthful immaturity on my part. So you tell me!.............. Is it just a foolish dreamer's fantasy to think "My Ms. Right," who has all those qualities, is actually out there?

text:
My inner grandpa is kind of shocked to read what's on craigslist these days, but I'll post on here anyway to clarify my thoughts.

I want to build a lasting, genius-level partnership with a woman who can understand and match my commitment to unconditional love. 

I mapped 12 qualities I want in a relationship to each musical note:

C - choosing as if we're blind. Here we are, I don't know what you look like and you don't know what I look like. Good looks will be the symptom of a good relationship, not the foundation. This is tricky for me because I'm a little vain, I've been told I'm handsome since I was like 4 years old, and on confident days I believe it's unequivocally true! So I just want our bodies and souls to fit together. (As far as bodies fitting together, check my stats and I will consider your opinion)

C# - willing to learn. I am an expert learner and passionate about deliberate change through practice. I'm looking for a smart partner who is willing to challenge herself and me.

D - willing to be like each other. Compatible lifestyles. I'm definitely willing to be like you, if you are aware, motivated, sexy, artistic, tidy, intelligent, fun, adventurous, and expansively loving.

Eb - willing to feel pain and show it. I care about your pain, and hey it's romance, emotions are gonna happen. I want someone who can feel these emotions and share them with me, and care about my experience as well.

E - has a life outside the relationship. My career and family/friends are extremely important to me (but honestly, a central part of my mission on this earth is around loving long-term romantic partnership)

F - shared passions. For the good times. My passions are learning, nature, sensuality (food sex massage jacuzzi afternoon-snoozing music etc), creativity and empowerment. I love animals and travel. I drink coffee but I'd quit for you if we were vibing.

F# - shared values. For the hard times. What are your top values? This is not a words discussion except retrospectively - I generally learn someone's values by observing their behavior. 

G - compassionate and flexible. Can listen. I care about listening and understanding your experience, as well as helping you be graceful with your experiences, and I would like the same in return.

Ab (G#?) - sense of humor about oneself. Here I am a sexy internationally known classical musician dithering about whether I should write Ab or G# on a ridiculous Craigslist ad instead of learning a new programming language and making an electronic tool for musicians to eliminate limiting beliefs. (which I could probably apply to myself and just manifest a girlfriend already?) (oh the irony)

A - willing to overlook the small things. I don't lie, I'm not addicted to anything (except unconditional love), and I will care to my last breath about loving my family and friends. Sometimes I say some dumb shit or drop a glass of wine. You will too. I'll still love ya.

Bb - as good of friends as lovers. This is important. I am looking for someone I can be a good friend and life collaborator with.

B - Makes our world bigger, not smaller. How important! Let's expand worlds together!

Does this sound interesting? We are back at C, do, Ut, 1, "mmmm" etc etc.. If you have a feeling we can jam together and some crazy melody of love is gonna emerge, shoot me a message. Just tell me what you think the secret code is? This is one where I haven't supplied the answer, I'm looking for what comes out of your creative depths. What's the secret code, dear one? If it doesn't feel compatible I'll let you know, nothing ventured nothing gained.

title: Pick up a great friend in Aisle 11
text:
So here's how I see this online dating....it's like shopping at the supermarket or Target or even Price Club (although that's requires yearly membership fees and who really needs to buy b*tch in bulk). They say never go hungry or you will pick up more than you want or need...point taken. They say always go with a list so you get everything you need, fair enough. So here we are looking at our lists, height requirement, age requirement, body type...you get the picture, let's shop with this thoughtful list of things we expect. 

Now depending upon how often you shop, or really what your long term goal is, you may just pick up a few things to get you by for the next few days or you fill up the cart. Either way you think you are prepared and still know what you want. But as you start to choose your items, or your potential mates, you start looking at the facts. Is it too many calories (are they smart enough), is it too much sodium (are they ambitious enough), does it have the daily recommended amount of riboflavin (i have no idea what riboflavin does, but perhaps that's the little something special)? You sometimes go down aisles that have nothing you want, just to see what's there. Sometimes you're pleasantly surprised and sometimes you just say, what on earth was I thinking, why am I wasting my time here. So you move along, still with your list in mind.

At the end of your trip, you think you have a set of items that you really want, based on your list of course. Maybe you picked something up and traded it for something else, leaving your original desire in the wrong aisle, but you're ready to check out and get your life moving. You're frustrated by the wait in line, you just want to get going, let's get it started. And then while you wait, something catches your eye. Maybe it's a pack of gum, or that special candy you loved as a kid (or this person you've met just said that one thing you always wanted to hear) and you're glad you had to wait. 

So you leave with all your items, or so you think, ready to move ahead. But then you get home and realize, damn, I forgot the bread, how could I forget something so basic that I need and want?!? That's what's in Aisle 11. The basics that you always need. Maybe it's not as exciting as the Asian foods in Aisle 4 or as spicy as the Goya products in Aisle 13, but it's what you need, it's what you're really looking for, and sometimes raisins are involved (ooo I love raisins). 

So lists are bad, perhaps necessary to keep you on track. I'm not gonna lie, I have one, but if you don't check them or update them, you get side tracked by the gum and have to go back to the store, now with no list and you end up with more than bread...always.

What's my point....I'm not really sure. But wasn't that better than me saying I love to laugh and travel. If you want to know more, drop me a note.

Happy shopping...and try Aisle 11, you may be surprised.

If you made it this far , reply with a pic. Trust me we are a match.

title: Do You Wear Stilletos While You Cook?
text:
I find myself posting on CL because I'm pretty fed up with dating in NYC. I've tried a few dating sites, done the speed-dating meat market thing, and trusted a few friends setting me up on blind dates. While I won't say that I can't meet interesting people at all, I will say that I have yet to meet that woman who I just can't wait to spend time with. The woman I can't wait to hug or kiss. So I guess it's time for a full court press. I guess you could say I'm a little lonely in this big ass city. While I'm not expecting much from CL, I may as well put out into the universe what it is that I seek and see what it yields.

To be quite blunt I find myself most attracted to Southern women, because they seem best personify the type of woman I seek. The title of the post is instructive here. The woman who wears stilletto's in the kitchen! An unapologetic lady who still is willing to get a little dirty. You love wearing skirts and dresses but also are comfortable in jeans. The type of woman I'm looking for probably doesn't have a checklist but is more interested in compatibility. But since we all have preferences here are a few of mine. I'm looking for a woman who is sexy, with her own sense of style and a great presence about her. You love life and are a delight to be around. You're intellectually curious and really smart and sophisticated yet still down-to-earth. You're family plays an important role in your life--even if they drive you crazy from time to time. You're more interested in finding compatibility than having 100 dates with different people. You believe in God but aren't a zealot and you are slim to curvy (read not classified as a "big girl").

You understands you're imperfect, but you're willing with time to give a little of herself to grow--and you can expect the same from me. You love being romantic as well as being romanced. Romance to you could be walking hand in hand through Central Park or eating sushi at home for a movie night. You're insatiably sensual, yet know when to be both appropriate and inappropriate ;-). You have a great sense of humor and you're interested in staying in shape. I'm not saying you have to have a perfect body but you value yours and do work out every now and again. Lastly, YOU LOVE FOOD!

FYI, I understand how the internet is so while I may not ask in the first email and I'm not asking now, but please be prepared to share a pic. Also don't confuse the title with a belief that a woman's role is in the kitchen...I cook too!

title: Old fashioned romantic with modern lefty politics seeks...same?
text:
I have some trouble dating, because I have a weird mix of old-fashioned and modern traits.

As a kid, I was taught conservative Catholic philosophy: love your family, avoid substance abuse, no sex before marriage, adultery is a sin, etc. I also had a very supportive, Italian-American style family with the kind of strong bond you don't always see anymore.

In college, I rebelled against the sexist and homophobic aspects of Catholicism and chucked the whole philosophy. Naturally, I started drinking and having some sex. I became politically liberal - and still am, for the most part.

Yet there are aspects of liberal philosophy that trouble me. Too many people in NYC seems to think that being liberal means sleeping around, abusing illegal substances, and riding bikes through red lights to annoy old conservatives. I am not that type of lefty. I'm more the work for a nonprofit, give back to the world type.

And in my private life, I guess I'm still conservative (in the small "c") sense. I would like to date a woman who actually likes her family, still believes in romantic love and is into monogamy. But in today's cynical world, I'm having a little trouble finding this person - especially since I still value liberal thought, and most old fashioned people don't. 

In short, I'd like to date an intellectual, moralist, feminist and yet somehow romantically inclined person. Impossible, right? Everyone is either a cookie-cutter wild child or ultra-conservative, right? 

Or maybe I'm wrong, and such a balance of philosophies actually exists somewhere. If it describes you...may I buy you dinner sometime?

title: Seeking Witty/Substantive Correspondence - Followed By a Date :-)
text:
I've been Internet dating for a while now, and one thing I've noticed is that the quality of my pre-date email correspondences has really plummeted lately. In the good old days, I used to exchange long, fascinating emails with my prospective dates, canvassing a wide range of topics. These days, most of the emails I get read like this: "I liked your post, you sound like a smart guy. I'm 5'5", BBW, with a heavy concentration of freckles on my left shoulder. Write back if interested." 

Well, I'm usually tempted to write back -- I do find freckles sexy, after all -- but I never know quite how to respond to such an email, because it contains zero useful information upon which to base a correspondence. I'm stunned, really, by the extent to which people are concealing literally *everything* about their lives when they write to me through Craig's List. I know it's wise to preserve one's anonymity on the Internet, but would it be too much to ask for folks to tell me what they do for a living, generally? What their first names are? Or what they do for fun?

In the absence of revealing substantive information about themselves, lately my correspondents have engaged me in a serious of weird meta-conversations about dating (e.g., "I can't believe I'm on Craig's List, everyone I've met through this site is nuts. I hope none of my co-workers find me here"). Since I have long since decided that I'm perfectly comfortable with the concept of Internet dating, these conversations don't really light me up. To make the situation even more frustrating, such conversations *very* rarely build up to the ultimate goal, that holy grail of online correspondence -- an actual date!

Which leads me to the point of this ad. I'm looking for two things that I used to find on CL all the time, but now seem as elusive as the aforementioned grail:

1) A substantive correspondence, in which you ask me questions to learn about me, and I ask you questions to learn about you. (A shockingly weird concept, I know. Ninety-seven point four percent of people on the Internet appear to have lost the habit of asking questions.)

2) A date. In the real world! Arranged and attempted without fear or shame arising from the concept of meeting people online.

To help this process along, I'm going to reveal a few facts about myself. I'm 35, I work for a nonprofit in Brooklyn, and I read voraciously and write (unpublished) fiction occasionally. Now, tell me about yourself -- job, hobbies, freckles or no freckles. . .? :-)

title: I prefer good grammar to good looks
text:
Well, maybe that's a bit of a stretch. An illiterate model will always win, but that's a rule everyone has. Anyhow, one of the most annoying things I find about reading posts on CL, or emails from respondents from CL, is their utter lack of writing ability. With respect to the posts, so many of them lack any capitalization, contain poor sentence structure and are quite disjointed as the author leaps from one thought to the other. It's quite annoying to read, and makes one think that the author must have, at best, a 3rd grade education. Their emails are usually perfunctory sentences that usually say nothing and make little sense. It is quite unattractive and makes you question the level of education of the writer. 

I am not asking for someone to write with perfect grammar, spelling or punctuation. Indeed, I have my own problems when it comes to those things. However, please try to make your emails and posts as literate and complete as possible. It certainly shows a complete lack of respect for the reader when you don't. We are trying to sell ourselves here. Why make it look like you should be in the bargain bin?

title: Hey! Over here!
text:
Folks, this is going to be an ad full of humor...brevity...honesty. I'm going to present to you something of an autobiographical personal. Unlike anything you'll ever read on Craigslist. 

I'm a Jersey-Boy, born and raised. 

(Insert the sound of dishes breaking here....)

(Cue: "Jersey?!! Wha....wait....this is a joke, right? You know you're on the wrong board, right? Or maybe you don't....")

No, I know I'm here. Just seems that I need to broaden my horizons, and cast a wider net, so to speak...especially as NJ seems to be slightly lacking. Plus, I don't mind traveling. Seriously. 

(Cue: But *I* do!!!)

Fine. I'll come visit YOU. But once in a blue moon, it would be nice to have you visit me, too. It's only fair.

Anyway....


I don't have an accent (that I know of), and I don't fist pump or flex my muscles (or lack thereof) in every mirror I pass. I'm not fake. I believe in being completely transparent. When you are with me, what you see is what you get. I have feelings and emotions, and - as strange as this sounds - I express them. I'm an old soul. I like to read and write. I've been known to spend my entire weekend at a library or bookstore. And why not? Reading is fundamental. I'm quirky. Not bad quirky, but fun quirky. I have an offbeat sense of humor. I still think some genres of music are "in", including disco. And, yes....I'm thoroughly aware that disco died the year I was born. I've written a game show (and at some point in life, would like to sell one....and maybe host it, if I can get over my fear of public speaking). And I've met several celebrities. I have a wonderful family, and I would give up everything I have for their happiness. I am truly blessed to have them in my life. 

I'm not a club or bar person. I don't enjoy the taste of alcohol, and quite frankly, I can't dance to save my life. 

I believe that the way to treat a lady is by being a gentleman. While it's probably not considered "cool" anymore, I will open your car door for you and it will be my pleasure. 

I'm well-spoken. I posses the ability to communicate in complete sentences. 

I'm a dreamer, and generous to a fault. 

And since I'm sure you feel that looks matter (they do...sort of....but they only get you so far....), here's my description (I'll be damned if I post a photo on Craigslist, as I have no idea who reads these things...)....height-wise, I'm 5'9 - give or take. Brown hair. Brown eyes. I have meat on me. And I can proudly state that I'm not only able to fit through turnstiles and revolving doors, but that I can also see my feet when I look down. 

I love nature and the outdoors. I have a piece of camping land that I share with friends of mine in upstate New York, and I try to escape there often. 

If you were to ask someone what they first notice about me.....

Well, there are a few things...and keep in mind, that I'm going by what I've been told over the years.

1): My sense of humor. I'm very quick witted, clever, and will freely poke fun at myself and my insecurities....and laugh about it, to boot.

2): My eyes. I don't get it. I really don't. They're brown. Round. They move back and forth, just like everyone else's...but people seem to like my eyes.

3): My attitude/personality: I've been called mellow, laid back, and easygoing more times than I care to remember. And I'll admit that it's true. What's the point of getting upset or angry on a daily basis? It just leads to stress and gray hair. Plus, it takes more energy to be upset than it does to be happy.

4): My obsession with cars. What can I say? I love cars. I've often wondered if I had gasoline in my veins. No, I cannot fix a car (go figure), but I can spout off any random spec you need to know. If it was up to me, I'd have one for every day of the week. Unfortunately, my budget won't allow it. I don't think my insurance carrier will, either.


"Okay", you say....."That's great and all....maybe....but what are YOU looking for? Surely, you MUST be looking for *something*, or you wouldn't be here!!!!"

I'm glad you asked. Because if you didn't, the next paragraph would make absolutely no sense. In no order, here are my "ten commandments". There might be more than ten....there might be less than ten. I'm not counting. Please just go along with me...

Commandment 1: Please leave all emotional baggage and drama at the door. 

(Cue: "Do I have to???")

Yes. 

Yes, you do. 

I've had my share of bad relationships over the years, as have you. We're both here for a reason....

(Cue: "Sex? Nigerian money scams??")

NO! (::bangs head against a wall::)

We're here to meet someone. Someone that doesn't complete us, but compliments us. If you have tons and tons of emotional baggage...or your world is filled with drama...we're probably not going to get along very well. 

(Cue: "But my son/daughter/dog/cat/recent divorce isn't baggage!!!")

I never said it was. And I won't turn you away. However, if you dress up like a chipmunk before sex...if you sleep with a gun under your pillow....or constantly call me by your ex-husband/boyfriend's name? You might want to stop reading here, and move on to the next personal ad.

Commandment 2: No cougars. Please. 

(Cue: "But age is just a number!! So what if I'm 90?!?!?!")

Yes. I've heard that before. Well, perhaps not 90....but you get the idea. There's one thing when the age difference is a few years (3) older than myself...but when there's a 10 year age gap...I can legally date your daughter...you are old enough to be my mom (or pretty damn close to it)...and you were alive when Gerald Ford was in office...I'm just not going to feel comfortable. 

(Cue: "Don't knock a cougar unless you've tried one!!")

I have tried a Cougar. I had one for close to two years...

(Cue: "I knew it!")

It was red. It had a luggage rack...a pinstripe....a swanky black cloth interior...

(Cue: "Wha...??")

Oh, wait....you weren't talking about a Mercury Cougar? Never mind. Sorry about that.


Commandment 3: Please have some form of income. 

(Cue: "Wait...you're not going to support me?!?!?! OMGWTF!!!!!")

Now, let me set the record straight. I almost always pick up the tab. I will absolutely help you out in a time of need (if I can). And I will never let you be homeless, or without food in your stomach. But I have bills to pay. And while I can afford to pay mine, I can't afford to pay yours, too. So please...have something resembling an income. 

(Cue: "But wait!! I obtain my money by......")

Stop right there. There's no need to fret. Unemployment, racketeering, loan sharking, ponzi schemes, and extortion are all valid forms of employment. Maybe not legal, but valid. 

Commandment 4: Transportation is a must. 

(Cue: "But I don't drive. Why exclude me?!?!")

I'm not excluding you. 

A bike is fine. A motorcycle is fine. Taxis, buses, trains, planes, and Zipcars are fine. Your feet - strange as this may sound - are an AMAZING form of transport, as is a Segway (just don't ride it near a cliff....). All I want, is to make sure that I'm not your personal taxi service. And yes, I've been there before. 

Commandment 5: Please be educated. 

(Cue: "Great. I was just starting to dig this guy, but he wants me to be educated...and I never finished college!")

Guess what? Neither did I. And it wasn't by choice, either. But just because you never finished college (or never went to college, for that matter...), doesn't mean that you stop learning. Take a cooking class. Read a good book. Write poetry. Something!! Have zest and thirst for knowledge. Knowledge is power. Hooray for knowledge!!

Commandment 6: Please write with some modicum of grammar. 

(Cue: "Reeeellleeee?? IDK if I likeeeeeee that")

Okay, right off the bat....."likeeeeeee" is NOT a word. It never has been, and it never will be. It's not even in the dictionary. I should know, as I've checked. Remember...first impressions are *everything*. Would you send an e-mail like that to your boss/colleague/professor/grandmother? I'd hope not....and I kindly ask that you don't send me one, either.

Commandment 7: Please be SINGLE. 

(Cue: "Uh...isn't this a given?")

That's a negative, Ghost Rider. 

Seems as though every time I've used Craigslist, I've received a lot of responses from people that are in unhappy and/or open relationships/marriages. While I'm flattered that you enjoyed my post, I'm not a marriage counselor. Nor am I a relationship therapist. Nor do I want to be part of your strange open marriage/relationship. I'm not here to break up someone's unhappy marriage/relationship, nor am I looking for a platonic buddy (I have enough of them, believe it or not - both female and male. Which reminds me...I need to start my Christmas shopping...). I'm here for a relationship. And you should be, too. If not? Well...you might want to check out the "Strictly Platonic" section. I'm sure you've seen it. It's the one for...uh...strictly platonic relationships.

(Cue: "But ur add waz so kewl!! Bewbz!!!")

First, please refer to Commandment # 6. Second...while I thank you (again) for the kind words...you're better off visiting the "Strictly Platonic" section. I'm serious about this. I kindly ask that we don't waste each other's time. Note: Telling me that your single...and lying about it...is not the best way to make a good impression with me. In case you think I'm joking about this, please remember that Google and Facebook are valuable tools. I've had more than my fair share of people pretending that they were single, only to find out that they were not. I honestly should make this my first commandment, but I'm too lazy to change the numbers and stuff around. 

Commandment 8: Serious replies only.

(Cue: "U mean no hai?")

Say what? Oh. I see. You're using "interwebz" speak again. Nice to see that you ignored Commandment # 6. Anyway, yes....serious replies only. Please. Nothing is more of a bummer than having your phone chirp, only to find out that it's an e-mail starting off with the following:

"Hi. While I don't think we'd be a good match/I'm married/in a relationship/I'm being eaten by the flying spaghetti monster, I just wanted to let you know...."

Yeah. 

Listen. While I appreciate the "shout out" to my ad, it's a waste of time for both of us. There's no need to send me an e-mail to indicate that you're not interested, but that you liked my ad. Please refrain from sending me these types of e-mails. If you've enjoyed my ad, kindly submit it to "Best of Craigslist". Perhaps they'll use it in a book, and I'll collect a royalty from it. That, or offer me a writing job. I'd dig that. 

And now...the last commandment. Commandment 9: Please love your family. 

(Cue: "All of them!?!? But I hate/don't have a relationship with/wish my ________ was dead/dying/eaten by the Flying Spaghetti Monster...")

Oh, c'mon. There has to be a member of your family that you love. Even if there are just one or two members that you cannot live without...that counts!!! (Yes...your dog/cat/bird/fish/magical backyard leprechaun counts as family. The corner butcher, town mechanic, or random dude stocking shelves at the local Food-O-Rama does not. Unless they ARE related to you, and then by all means, yes...they count as family.) 


Okay. I've written enough here. Hopefully, I've held your interest.


And before I forget.....why should you write me?

1): You want someone that will make you laugh for hours on end. Guaranteed, or your money back.

2): You want someone who loves animals: I will not only love your dog/cat/bird/fish/pet leprechaun, I will care for him/her as though it were my own.

3): You want a family-oriented man: My family - small as they may be (in size, not height...except for my mom and grandmother) - are my WORLD. Caps for emphasis. If I had to, I'd live out of a cardboard box to ensure their happiness and well-being.

4): You don't want a jerk: I've never cheated on, abused, or put down any woman I've ever dated.

5): You want someone DIFFERENT in your life: I can promise you that I'm NOT the same old, same old.

6): You have nothing better to do: Well, no. Please don't respond if you have nothing better to do. I'm better than that, and deserve better than that.

So...with that said...

If you've made it THIS far....please. Drop me a line. 

Oh - before I forget - please put your age and something else (favorite activity, color, tv show) in the subject line. If not, I'll assume that you're a robot, and delete your e-mail.

title: In-between our corporate cages
text:
You work in a corporate environment, routinely and efficiently knocking out those daily tasks, monthly plans, and annual targets. You see the same people daily, smile at them, make small talk in the elevator, sometimes collaborate, and then retreat to your own desk - an occasional oasis in this place. You take lunch everyday around the same time, and often eat at your desk because work inertia isn't letting you rest and distract yourself. Thoughts of getting things done quicker give you fuel to keep working and working, hopeful to experience sensations that exist outside of work. At meetings, your colleagues ramble, but sounds coming out of their mouths eventually subside as your mind wonders to our last encounter, recalling the way I touched you, the plush feeling of our lips connecting, the wet interweaving of our tongues, the synchronous motion of our bodies moving through blissful pleasures of sex, and you can't help but feel butterflies in your stomach in anticipation of our next rendezvous.

title: Are You What I'm Looking For?
text:
Good day. 

I'm looking for a partner, a mate. 

But. I am old enough to know exactly what I want. And I'll get into that briefly. First, however, two points (this will be funny later). 

First, I know that many women, as I name six things I want, and they don't match on one item, they think they're not a match. That's wrong. To prevent this, I've set up the 'what I need and want' part of this ad on a point system. Yes, it's a tad sophomoric but it will help the mostly-qualified find their way to me. That's my hope, desire and design anyway. So, get out a pencil. 

Second, about me, which you'll need to know this in order to decide whether to reply and invest. I'm 43, white, live in Manhattan, no kids. I am 5'9" and about 190lbs, although I'm usually closer to 180. I am a casual runner -- three half marathons this past year. I make more than $150,000 a year in a professional setting which includes fun and fluid freelance work. I also have several projects which, with good fortune, may become quite lucrative. Most people describe me as funny and smart. I love cultural and intellectual pursuits and travel. I'm not an outdoors guy, I prefer a lodge to a tent and a good Old Fashioned to light beer. I have outstanding manners and am a liberal. 

Now it gets interesting and where I expect to lose 90% of those who read this far (and thank you). There are really two non-negotiable points or traits that my partner has to have. I know it just won't work if she's not both of these things. After that, I can be more flexible. 

The first. Please only reply if you're willing to be in a sexually open relationship. I don't mean emotionally or life-sharing. I am looking for a life-mate, the (singular) person with whom I share everything. No secrets. But I also know I enjoy, will seek and find sexually adventurous activities. I want to do these things with my mate and with her knowledge and, ideally, with her enthusiastic support as well. As long as we're safe and honest with each other, I expect her to enjoy herself as well -- with the security of my loyalty. 

Second must-have. I need a mate who is submissive. Both in a traditional gender role (50s household) way and sexually. I am an experienced Dom and won't be compatible with someone who lacks the deep need to submit and be controlled as well as have and follow rules. Understand, I am not looking for a rag doll -- I love strong women. But, with me, the one I love will need to explore her boundaries and need to give herself to her love, unconditionally. In public, we'd a dynamic and collaborative. Together, we'd follow a rather strict D/s protocol. 

I fully understand those two items aren't for everyone. But I'm not seeking anyone, I am seeking the right one. There are few other yes/or deal killers but I'll get to those right away. Therefore, if you're still here (thank you again), here's more about the one I'm looking for. As promised, quiz style. Pencils ready? 

White, European +1 point. 
Black or Central American -- sorry, this won't work. 

Between 5'3" and 5'9" +1 
Between 5'6" and 5'8" +1
Between 26 and 35 years old +1
Over 35 -- no, but thank you.

title: Married Asian Male Venting
text:
Newly married Asian male feeling unhappy. Wife doesn't live with me since she is in a different state while I am transitioning to there. So my wife recently asked me "If your mom and I (meaning her) were in a burning building, who would you save?" I usually have the same answer. I don't know since both are very important to me. If I save one or the other, I would end up committing suicide at the end constantly picturing/replaying the facial expressions the other would have if I am not able to save them. I imagine their physical pain from the fire and emotional pain from being felt behind. Imagine living with that for the rest of your life. At the end I wouldn't be able to handle the guilt and probably kill myself somehow. Seems like every relationship I get into I get asked that question expecting my answer to be "you of course". However if my family owned a fortune and I was the heir to it but tell me I wouldn't get it if I marry who they didn't approve of THEN I can genuinely say I would choose to still marry who I want, over inheriting my parent's fortune. Since it took me so long to find the love of my life, no amount of money can replace that and if I chose the money, I would end up losing most of it since it will only attract "gold diggers". 

I am inter-racially married (mentioning that since I guess there may be a clash in cultures and family beliefs) and for a couple of years. I can't say I'm the happiest. I am a saver (financially). All my life I have saved and prepped financially for retirement (at age 22), having a future family, emergencies, and current expenses. However all of that has been totally wiped out because of my wife (at the time we were dating).. when we use to live in NY, she wanted a car (just because she never owned one). I have owned 5 in my life time (one at a time) traveling from place to place and when I use to work longer distances. We didn't need a car with our situation but she nagged for over 6 months and got furious when I disagreed with her desire for getting a car just because...on top of that, she didn't know a thing about cars so she chose a car based on how "cute" it looked. We ended up getting an SUV with a faulty engine and other problems. At the end we ended up selling it to a dealership for a fraction of how much we got it for but not after we spend almost twice what we paid in repairs. 

I was and still am the current and only income earner between us but she goes and eats out, spends time out with her friends, and buying cosmetics. I'm basically paying for all of that, the car note, insurance, rent, necessities, etc. I moved back in with my parents just traveling back and forth between states to try and transition job wise. title: ISO Married Woman
text:
I'm looking for a married woman I can have a romantic relationship with. Someone I look forward to seeing, being with, emailing, etc. Someone who I can have an ongoing relationship with that is not bogged down with a never ending list of household emergencies and financial strain. I miss that, and haven't had that for years.

Ideally it would be someone who lives or works in midtown Manhattan and can meet for lunch or after work for a bite. I do have a schedule that is fairly busy but can also be a little uneven. Some weeks I can hardly leave my desk to get a drink of water, other times I can leave for a few hours and no one would be the wiser. But in any event I would like meet someone who is somewhat understanding of having a job that can be demanding at times.

Things I am not looking for.. A sex only relationship. This would not be the ad for you, but trust me, if that's what you are looking for, you won't be looking for long. A sugar daddy relationship is not appealing either (getting taken advantage of is not really my thing).. or even an entertainment buddy (i.e. someone just looking for anyone to take them out dancing and to clubs.) And that is not to say I'm against having fun.. I'm just not a club kind of guy.

I am a fairly young looking guy who can easily pass for mid thirties. I'm also fairly athletic. I won't be mistaken for a pro athlete anytime soon, but I don't have a gut and mostly keep up with the twenty somethings when playing pick-up sports. . . mostly. For the person I'm looking for, age isn't incredibly important. I've met 50 year olds who are energetic and very attractive, and thirty somethings that are stuffy and have all but given up.

I appreciate sarcastic and witty humor. I enjoy conversation and a good story. I like pondering life just as much as making fun of all the ridiculous things I go through along the way. Finding someone who is intelligent is pretty high on my list. I like to think of myself as a straight shooter. 
My 'type' can often be classified as 'girl next door'. Heavy makeup is somewhat of a turn off for me. Bright lipstick and thick foundation in particular. 

I do have a white collar job, though I get to wear jeans to work which is nice. I've worked at places where people dress a lot nicer but were somehow far less professional, so very happy to make that trade. I mention that because if you're looking for Wall street type or hedge fund broker, that's not me. I'm probably more of someone who you might picture as working at an internet startup. I also am a creative person. If you are too, then we will have plenty to talk about.

So if you've made it this far, definitely drop me a line. I don't expect a lot of response from this ad, and I'm happy to reply to everyone who takes the time to write, even if it doesn't seem like a match. If it seems like a good fit on paper, then I'd love to meet out in person. No expectations in a meet up, other than just to say hi and have a pleasant conversation. (I understand that there are some rather crude people out there, but match or not, I'm not one of them). And it should also be noted that Craig's list is notorious for having their emails go to spam, so if you don't hear from me, check there. 

And pictures.. To be honest, I'm not a particular fan of sending pictures due to the particular circumstances of this ad. I'm more than happy to meet out for a quick drink without a picture exchange if you're willing, but I also understand people's reluctance to do that. I do have a picture I can send but it's purposely a little blurry. I think the picture is good enough to know that I'm attractive but isn't good for telling much more beyond that. Hopefully if you're looking for something similar, you can take a chance and maybe be pleasantly surprised. In any case my reluctance to exchange pictures has nothing to do with how good looking I am, or am not. Personally, I think I'd get a lot better response rate if I just posted a bunch of pictures of myself, but unfortunately there would be some not so nice ramifications from that as well.

One last thing. While I can't promise a great deal with this ad, I will promise I will never ignore an email. I know there are a lot of people who use having an anonymous email as an excuse to behave poorly, but that's not my style and I'm very up front. If I don't think it's a match I'll let you know.

title: Are you creative, intelligent and sensual?
text:
It seems that every ad I read in the "Women Seeking Men" section the writer describes herself as being either "creative", "intelligent" and/or "sensual". Even if she begrudgingly acknowledges that she may not be beautiful and that she may be curvy, the author, seemingly imbued with greater credibility for having confessed her shortcomings, still tells the reader what other fabulous categories she possess. Of course, these are qualities that are far more subjective and thus far easier to credit yourself with having.

As someone who has met and engaged quite a number of women over the years, I can tell you that very few are creative, intelligent and sensual. Some may possess one of those categories, fewer still 2, and very few all 3. Ditto for men. So, please don't take this strictly as a screed against women, because it is not.

All I am asking for is a some honesty and self-awareness. Indeed, if you were truly creative, you should be able to do better in creating an ad where all you do is just state that you are "creative". The same goes for sensual and intelligent. Saying you are creative doesn't make you creative.

If you would like to discuss further, or if you would like to write me and say simply that you are not overly creative, not overly sensual and not overly intelligent, but that you are a nice person, lets talk. Nice is good, and a good start...

title: Online Seeking
text:
Online seeking...She couldn't believe she was actually considering it. However, the prospect of bar hopping tonight just didn't seem all that appealing. the same conversations with her single girlfriends. The same predictable propositions from hipsters, players and egomaniacs who differed only in their choice of designer jeans and button down shirts. There had to be another way. after all, she was an attractive, intelligent woman who could turn a phrase and heads alike. Perhaps - just maybe - there was a gentleman of the same caliber on the other side of the screen, simply waiting for a girl who was willing to take a chance. She glanced over the plethora of subject headings looming in front of her. scrolling. . .scrolling

. . . No, I don't care what kind of car you drive or claim to have. No, I wouldn't like a free foot massage from a complete stranger. No, I am not a submissive, exotic female who's into role playing and s&m. maybe this was a bad idea. Wait. This one looks promising. something about his writing style caught her eye. The way he strung together phrases, interjected humor and laced his intentions with astute observations. There was a sexual subtext - subtle enough to pique her interest and arouse her curiosity. Could it be as good as it sounded? Her mind raced with the possibilities. Unconsciously, she began tracing the neckline of her top with her fingers. She thought about the last time she allowed a man to place his hands on her. It had been a while. She missed the sensation of a casual touch on her arm, a more daring placement of a hand on her knee and the sweet release of a first kiss. It would feel so nice to be held close on such a cold night as this. She pictured it happening in a cozy booth of a dimly lit bar. They'd be joking, laughing, flirting - amazed at the ease with which this was progressing. The music was loud and he had to lean in close so that she could understand. he paused there just long enough to exhale. A warm stream of air moved down across her ear and over her neck as she attempted to conceal the fact that she had shivered. Her inhibitions would disappear with the last sip of her cocktail. He'd be waiting for a sign. a leg crossed in his direction - a comment punctuated by her fingers on his arm - that slight lean in that told him it was ok to do the same.

His kiss would be tentative at first. Soft but confident, making her feel as if they were removed completely from the noise and confusion of the bar. She wouldn't let things go further than what she was comfortable with. She was in control. that's not to say she was opposed to losing it under the right circumstances. This felt good. this felt right. he didn't know it yet, but tonight. . . she'd be going home with him. She hardly remembered typing her reply. She thought twice about attaching a picture - but, emboldened by her daydream, she finally chose an image that suggested both a shy nature and the potential for mischief and playfulness.

title: Kind SWM for Sweet SAF
text:
Hello :)

I am here looking to find a kind, loving and fun SAF for a LTR. I know CL is a hard place to find something meaningful, but I have some hope that there are others like me posting here who are looking for something real. 

So, about me...I'm 37, 6' tall with blonde hair, light blue eyes, an athletic build and a good head on my shoulders. I am very lighthearted and am always joking around when I can because life is too short to be serious all the time. I have a good heart and will do anything to help those I love. 

I've traveled a good amount and want to travel much more, preferably with someone special to share it with. I enjoy exploring NYC to eat great food, have good red wine, take in the arts, watch live comedy or music, see street performers/artists and anything else that gives me intellectual stimulation. I also really enjoy relaxing at home, more so with someone special to me that I can cuddle with and share intimate moments. 

I like exercising, snowboarding in the winter, reading, self-improvement, have always been a gamer to some degree, a closet nerd and not generally concerned with what other people think of me. I also love learning new things from new people that come into my life and seeing things from a different perspective. 

So, what am I looking for in a partner? I need a woman that can be herself, be fun, exciting, caring, considerate, sexy, passionate, laughs a lot and who also cares about herself and has positive direction in her life. She should have a good heart and be humble, no matter how beautiful she is. She should also love animals and squee at puppy and kitten videos...because who doesn't love a good puppy or kitten video? Lol! 

I want her to show me how she feels and never hide it out of fear, because I absolutely need reciprocity in a relationship. I give 100% all the time and never drag past hurt into a new relationship. I just want someone that is honest with herself and with me, all the time. Without trust for each other, there is no point. 

Physically, I am attracted to a woman that takes care of herself, cares about her appearance and who is a beautiful person on the inside as much as she is on the outside. I like when a woman enjoys looking good for herself and expressing her femininity. That being said, if you are beautiful but lack personality, or are a mean-spirited person, I will not find you attractive at all no matter how well you rock a dress and high heels. I need overall stimulation and attraction for my partner where we have chemistry on all levels, not just physical. 

Please send several photos with your reply, and not just face photos. I want to feel your sincerity in taking the time to write something meaningful back to me. Your photos get the rest of mine, and I am not shy to share more about myself if I feel you are the right person to invest more time in. If we hit it off, I want to meet you and have a real connection sooner than later, not just endless texts or calls. 

As far as my preferred age range...I will say 26-42. I am open to younger or older if total chemistry is there, you are emotionally mature, know what you want and there is no drama or BS. So, if you are a little outside those numbers then feel free to say hello. 

Please put "Sincerity" in your subject line so I know you are most likely not spam...and so I know that you actually took the time to read my novelette of a posting ;)

title: Me Romeo, You Juliet; Me Clyde, You - Bonnie
text:
Good Evening Ladies,

I thought it would be a fun journey to hop on craigslist and post an AD to search for a mate. I will make it short and sweet. 

I am curious to see how many successful woman desire to partner with a man that is truly 100% faithful, patient, gentile, nurturing, understanding, serious yet fun loving, communicative, and career oriented. Rhetorical Right? I am not rich but besides the fact, over the years, I refined as much knowledge I could to ensure that I'd know what to do to ensure the success of a fresh relationship. So what is it did I learn?

I learned how to proper manage various parts of my relationship from learning to cook, how to treat my mate, to take care of a household, how to advance plan and coordinate our activities, how to manage my career, and finances and a whole lot more. This is not my claim to perfection but its my efforts to learn from the mistakes of others and do for a woman who appreciates sincere efforts. I don't even have millions of dollars, nor a huge extended family. Bottom line is I am genuine, a diamond in the rough. If I do what it takes to make it work, are you the type who'd be willing too also? Thus, If you are, I can guarantee that we would be a near perfect match and we'd be able to have many joyous days together. Well a little more about me shall we and what kind of lady I am looking for. 

I am 32 years old, with no kids, never married. I was born in Brooklyn and have always been a native New Yorker. I do not drink nor do I smoke. Drug and alcohol free. I am disease free, nor have I ever caught one, its how I'll forever plan for it to be. Moreover, i do like to have fun I like to watch movies, listen to good music, read, exercise, travel and much more. Are you ready for good times? A Brighter future? I hope you are. I can see us already. Are you the one, I am hoping to find? Out of heaven dropped a dime. Read on to see the qualities I seek. And if your still reading, Hopefully, you'll be the one I meet. 

I am hoping to find a confident, beautiful, career or business centered woman-with preferences to doctors, lawyers, family oriented, spiritual and balanced, intelligent, and results driven. If your a woman that desires to get grounded with a man that will never leave your side then I am filling out applications and handing out resumes. I am open to all races at the moment, single parent with a child welcomed.

Anticipating responses thanks, 

Sincerely Yours,

David
